text:
650 ml bottle, pours red/chestnut, hazy, offwhite creamy head.
aromas of wood, raisin, honey, vanilla, whiskey, and baked apples.

full to medium body, soft to medium carbonisation. oily texture, maybe a bit heavy on the sweetness, rather sticky finish
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
At RBBest. Pours reddish amber. Aroma is candy, bourbon, vanilla. Body is heavy, sweet, with barrel again. Sweet palate. Works very well!

Tap @RB Best. Pours lightly hazy hazel with a a medium beige head, dissipates slowly, good lacing. Aroma is oak, bourbon, caramel and toffee, malty with a hint of vanilla and a faint touch of copper pennies. Flavor is fully sweet and light plus bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle from Brew Bristol.
Medium off-white head, red/amber colour, cloudy, nice lacing.
Aroma: barrel, oak, plums, raisins, bit of alcohol.
Taste: light sweet with lightly dry + alcohol aftertaste.
Full body, thick, soft carbonation.

650 ml bottle. Pours a hazy light copper with a nice beige head with relatively small pores. Intense aroma with lots of whisky notes, wood and vanilla. Medium to full body with a light to medium carbonation. Medium to heavily sweet with a very light bitterness. The taste is very rich of various aromas, again with whisky, brown sugar, caramel, honey, raisins, cinnamon and also some alcohol. Overall very enjoyable beer on which you can sip for quite a while, maybe a little too much sweetness.
A: Deep red coloured with a offwhite head N: Vanilla, bourbon, grapefruit T: Caramel, bourbon, vanilla, hint of raspberry candy O: Surprised by how good this is! Fresh and nice flavours.

Bottle, bought @Beershoppen, Kolding. Mild gusher. Pours clear amber with a tiny, fizzy off-white head that soon disappears. Quite a bit of floaties. Aroma has lots of Vanilla, fat caramel, biscuits and oak. Fine creamy mouthfeel, subdued carbonation. Flavour is sweet, vinious and Vanilla. Light oaky dryness to go with the viniousness, sticky caramel as well. Too sweet and too one-sided.

Smooth malty caramel cocktail, toffee, some wood impact, corduroy, moderate sweet with light bitterness.
Lovely but nothing fancy

65 cl bottle @ Timo A.
Pours dark mahogany red color with a small head, lots of sediment floating around. Sweet caramel and malts on the nose, mild nutty tones, some vanilla and bourbon notes, faint bread, syrupy sweetness. Sweet caramel malty flavor, nutty dry notes, resin, very subtle chocolaty tones, vanilla. Smooth and sweet, quite pleasant, alcohol comes slightly through but nothing disturbing.
5424

22 oz bottle. Courtesy of olio.
Clear red amber color with a tiny tan head and some floaters.
Sweetness, marmalade, resin and caramel malt in the aroma.
The flavor is sweetness, malt, marmalade, apricot and some alcohol. German Bock notes. Strong red ale if you ask me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Shared 22 oz. bottle. Pours medium brown/copper and hazy with a beige head. Aroma of booze and malt. Taste is malt, bourbon, caramel, and wood with faint vanilla notes. Decent.

Aroma: lots of bourbon, vanilla and malt; Appearance: cloudy red pour with fairly thin off white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: follows nose but body a little thin; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: good but not amazing; might buy again.
Ruddy pour, big foamy off white head. Aroma of cherry, caramel, toffee, spices. Taste follows, with a lesser kick. Quite malty. Nice.

Pours with a large, slow head over a deep copper colored body. Boozy aroma first strikes me as rum. As it warms the alcohol becomes more distinct as whiskey, while malts provide a backdrop of caramel with a light roasted nuttiness. Smooth and silky, malty sweet yet tempered with that roast bitterness. Whiskey notes are obvious in the flavor, and the alcohol provides a pleasant warming sensation to the palate and gullet. Ive been to a few "Festivals of Barrel Aged Beers" and I think this offering would fare well. ~~~~ 22 oz. bomber, purchased at the brewery.

Sampled on draft at the brewpub this beer poured a dark bronze color with a medium sized foamy orange-white head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was caramel, golden fruit, honey and coconut. The flavor was caramel, toasty malts, honey, golden fruit, coconut and a hint of smoke. Medium length finish. Medium body. Interesting.
Rubí limpio y espuma marfil. Aromas de bourbon, maíz, fondo de Malta acaramelado. Cuerpo sedoso y denso, sabor dulce de bourbon y final seco.

Keg at Craft Holborn. It pours clear dark amber with a thick yellow - beige head. The aroma is rich, sweet, vanilla custard, creamy coconut, toffee, brown bread and fruit cake. The taste is pretty damn sweet upfront, vanilla, creamy, coconut, custard, toffee, alcohol warmth, fruit cake and wood with a dry, boozy finish. Medium - full body and moderate carbonation. A bit sweet and boozy, but fun in small doses.

Keg at CBC CG, London. It pours a clean golden color with a small white head. Aroma is sweet bold and lightly yeasty with notes of raisins, vanilla, liqueur and oak chips. Taste is also sweet and boozy with more notes of toffee and raisins. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, ok

Bomber 2014 vintage poured a clear orange amber with a small lasting amber head. Aromas of bourbon, oak, toffee,, fruitiness and vanilla. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, fruitiness, bourbon and light oask with a smooth finsh.

Pours a deeo burgundy red with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of caramel, ripe red apple, fruit jam, figs, dates, oak, butterscotch. Taste is caramel sweetness with fruity and berry notes with a robust malty backbone and some faint barrel musky character. Mouthfeel is lighter than expected with average carbonation.

Pours cloudy deep reddish copper with low white head. Aroma of toffee, butterscotch, jam and light bourbon. Taste is sweet with caramel and butterscotch, lightly booze sweet finish. Medium to rich bodied and creamy with smooth carbonation.

650cl bottle shared in a snifter. Pours deep red with a beige head which soon disappears. Aroma is buttery bourbon with dried fruits. Mouthfeel is quite thin and highly carbonated for the style and especially considering the barrel-aging. Taste is nicely balanced with fruity and buttery notes and even though there is no bitterness it is not cloying. A good example of the style and more refreshing and balanced than most.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Mahogany coloured pour no head. Aromas of toffee, chestnuts, caramel and orchard fruit. Flavours of toffee, treacle, caramel and red apple. Rich, warming taste. Good stuff.
Bottle: pours dark reddish brown with a thick foamy head, boozy and malty aroma, taste is touch hoppy, malty and a little boozy with a very smooth finish

Deep amber with very little white head. Intense but balanced aroma of plumbs, grapes, raisins and maybe even some strawberry. Really nice! The taste is very sweet and smooth and has maybe a faint smokiness. The aftertaste has a nice sharpness to it. Nice complexity.

Bomber. Pours a turbid brown, so-so head. Nose is candy sugar, barrel, big fuckin caramel. Mouth is sticky and big bodied with sharp carbonation, mostly on the sweet side, brown sugar, maple syrup, ripe apples, raisins, vanilla, figs, booze, bourbon, Buttery toffee finish. Solid. Hoppin Frog makes some bad ass beers.

Keg at Cafe Beermoth, Manchester. Reddish shade with a fluffy head. Lots of candied fruit notes in the aroma and barrel is there too. Taste is fruity, red apple, gummy worms, brown sugar. A bit dry and fairly drinkable. Decent stuff.

660ml bottle shared with friends. Somewhat hazy amber with a small off-white head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with nice subtle bitter tones. Oak, dried fruits, raisin, vanilla, caramel and malts. Wow, this brew was awesome!
Bottle at tasting. Aroma of sweet raisin, vanilla and caramel. Taste is really sweet, with raisin, caramel, vanilla and malt. Nice, but a little sugary.

Old note. The aroma has bourbon/vanilla/wood, caramel, fruity tones. Bit hazy, amber-red-brown coloured beer with an off-white, big head. The taste is light bitter, has caramel malty sweetness, bread, bourbon, some dried fruits. Medium-full bodied. Nice one.

Pours a very cloudy and very dark ruby red color with blood orange edges and a one finger white head that quickly settles into a thin, lasting ring. Minimal spotty lacing left behind. 

Theres a prominent whiskey barrel presence in the aroma with subtle vanilla bean and a strong spicy rye character that overpowers the notes of the base beer. The barrel notes are really nice but thats all I can pick up until this beer warms up considerably. 

On the lighter end of medium body with a spicy whiskey barrel presence thats nicely integrated into the flavors of the base beer. The aroma is one dimensional but the flavor profile is a bit more complex. There is a lot of interesting barrel flavor with dry oak/charred wood, silky vanilla bean and toasted coconut along with spicy rye and boozy sweetness. Lots of alcohol/spirit flavor but theres little to no heat. The high ABV is nicely masked with a sweet malt backbone balancing out the rougher edges. Hints of caramel and toffee with faint hops and subtle dark fruit notes toward the finish. Not the most interesting barrel aged beer out there but theres decent complexity and its surprisingly easy to drink. I enjoyed drinking this beer but wouldnt seek it out again.
Bottle at home. Pours deep orange amber, nose is malty, caramel, toffee, vanilla, fruity, taste is juicy fruit, sweet toffee and vanilla.

Rated on 9-01-2015 (Bottle) The appearance is an extremely small tan head with a long retention, murky amber body, fizzy carbonation, no lacing, and a lot of sediment. The aroma is oak, some malt, vanilla, spice and alcohol. The flavor is whiskey, malt, spice, and vanilla. The mouthfeel is moderate carbonation and this beer is medium bodied. This beer is quaffable with a good flavor but I will be doing a re-rate to get a better impression of it due to the small pour from a 22oz. bottle. It is worth trying.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a small sized head of foamy finely sized off-white colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a softly carbonated semi-hazy with floating particulate dark red brown colored body and a good lacing. The mild aroma was rye and bready. The sharp crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a mellow vinous aftertaste. The yummy flavor contained notes of bitter rye mild dough mildly vinous burnt malt crisp and hops. Delicious and one I would certainly like to have again.

Bottle at Cafe Sara, november 14th 2014. Dark orange body with a small head. Aroma of sweet vanilla and whisky. Taste of burned caramel, wood, mango and plum. Solid traces of whisky without having a strong alcohol taste. Quite nice

Rating No.6300
Bottled 650ml. -at Svijet Piva Zagreb. Murky brown coloured, small to medium sized off-white head, caramel and wood in the nose. Rather toasted malt, alcohol, wood, caramel and touch of dried fruits and smoke with also notes of alcohol and vanilla in the finish. Very good beer but after Doris and Boris a bit letdown from the brewery.

Bomber, 2014 vintage. Caramel malt aroma with excellent whiskey, vanilla, oak and toffee notes. Pours amber-ruby colored with a thin tan head with good retention and some lacing. Starts with sticky, sugary caramel and toffee sweetness and mouthfeel. Finishes smooth with nice whiskey, vanilla and oak undertones. Excellent barrel aged scotch ale albeit slightly over sweet.

Draught @ Hoppin Frog, Akron, OH
Pours hazy reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruits, alcohol and faint hint of oak. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long warm, caramel and dried fruity finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Dark ruby amber color with small light brown head and no lacing. Aroma and flavor have big whiskey notes and woodyness, nice caramel malts, and warming alcohol tingle. Very good overall

On tap at the taproom. An almost clear one, dark amber in color and with a small dark beige head. The aroma is malty and sugary with a nice hoppy touch. Toffee notes. A bit sweet on the palate, full bodied and smooth with a certain warmth. Toffee, some light roasted malts, dark sugar and a nice bitterness in the flavor, lasting for a good while. Not much booze detected. Nice, not superb. 150616

Huge, dense & fine cream-coloured head, slightly irregular over (cold)hazy red-amber beer. Quite fruity nose (mainly orange) with a vinous streak, liqueurish. Caramel, cake with brandy/rum... Bitterish, sweet, with a lactic streak. Vanilla, strawberry, liqueur, ripe banana. Wood in every new sip, always ending in the creamy liqueur. Feels very lively carbonated. Slick to viscous, thick body, velvety feel. Excellent.

Served alongside Outta Kilter.

 Nearly identical appearance to the base beer. The BA version is slightly darker. Bourbon character is mild in the aroma, emerging mid palate with a light tannic note. Well blended. Wet breads, fruit, malt, tannic notes, oak, cotton candy, barrel, bourbon. Medium body with a bit of stickiness on the palate. Tasty.

Butelka 60cl. 
OCZY : śliczne piwo o kolorze czerwonym z średniej wielkości piana o kolorze szarym. 

NOS : w zapachu szybko wychwytam nuty whisky, suszonych i kandyzowanych czerwonych owoców. Do tego tarta, banan i wanilia. Pachnie słodko a nuty whisky są głębokie o ciepłych o wyraźnych nutach wanilii. Jest fajnie. 

USTA : średnio nasycone. Piwo jest gęste, oleiste i przyjemnie puszyste. 
Słodkie ale nie klejące. Przy końcu robi się coraz bardziej wytrawne. Gorzkość jest bardzo delikatna. Piwo szybko rozgrzewa alkoholem. Wytrawne nuty przypominają drewno i delikatnie goździki. Alkohol podkreśla mocny aromat whisky a gorzkość jest ziemista. Słodkość natomiast przypomina kandyzowane owoce. Posmak jest średnio intensywny. 

ODCZUCIA : zauroczyło mnie kolorem, mocnym aromatem whisky i dobrze wyważonym smakiem. Z drugiej strony posmak jest troszeczkę za mało intensywny.

22 oz. bottle. Dirty brown/ copper with spotty head. Aroma is light rum, vanilla from the barrel, English toffee and light raisins. Body is a bit on the thinner side with a almost watery texture. The flavor is still decent. Toasted oak, rum, vanilla, thin toffee, with a rum type finish. I get more of a rum barrel rather than a Bourbon. Thin body but the flavor is still here.

Poured from bottle thanks Adrian. Pours reddish brown with a thin white head. Aromas of bread caramel and hints of vanilla. Taste is smooth with toasted oak and caramel and a nice hint of booze in the finish.

Dark red, 1 finger head that faded fast. Smells like raisin, clove, sweet brown sugar. Lavender and cherries. Tastes like really boozy beer for 8%. Rubbing alcohol, rum, cane sugar, nutmeg, pumpkin, brown sugar. very boozy finish. tastes like malty rum.
Amber coloured and hazy. Has an off-white head, lasting. Aorma has notes of vanilla, sweet, and vegetables.

A reddish, dark brown beer with a medium and beige head. The aroma is strongly sweet and berry, caramell, some bread and dark chocolate, dry barrel and vanilla. Taste has riped fruits, caramelly and rich maltyness, not too sweet, vanilla, some barrel and hint of chocolate. Warming alcohol without taste in the end. Almost full bodied, nice and smooth, not sticky. Clearly better than normal Outta Kilter without barrel. The good beer, complex and balanced.

My Bottom Line:
This Barrel-Aged Scotch Ale is bothered by cardboard notes which surround caramel malts and the vanilla undercurrents offered by the oak.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam tops the turbid dark red.
-The flavor profile is unrefined.
-There is no date on the bottle, so I have no idea how old this is. But it is clearly past its peak, which is strange for such a strong brew bought in a good store.
-Carbonation is relatively low.

Bottle.

22oz bomber. Big booze in the aroma...caramel whiskey harshness. Kind of filtered amber body Not much of a head. Barrel forward, like someone poured some cheap scotch in your beer. Pretty big for the ABV...but at the same time pretty damn smooth. OK...Im starting to feel it...this one is quite nice, sublime, the barrel is pretty well incorporated after a few sips. In 2015, this is a great Scotch Ale.
light fruit Vanilla aroma,amber, hazy, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice barrel aged finish.
Bottle. Hazy amber colour with medium creamy white mostly lasting head. Hoppy aroma. Barrel. Sweet and bitter flavor. Creamy palate.

22oz bottle pours a murky caramel amber with some cloudy white head. Nose has plenty of caramel and vanilla, quite boozy, some orange, heavy butterscotch. Flavor has more traditional toasted oak notes, plenty of butterscotch and toffee, plenty of whiskey, some soap. Finishes boozy and quite tannic. Perhaps laying this down for 12-18months is a good idea.

Ennek bizony nagyon jót tett a hordós érlelés, elvesztette a gumicukros ragacsosságát, kiegyensúlyozottabb lett, karamellás, meggyes, bourbonos, pici illatos dohányfüsttel, nem túl édes, pont jó. Gratula az ötletért!

Pours clear deep amber into a thistle. Off-white head with little retention recedes to mottle surface. Sweet vanilla and oak aromas. Sweet caramel and vanilla upfront turning to dry bourbon in the lasting finish.

Bottle to glass. Pours a beautiful burnt sienna color with a thin off white head. Aroma is a mild scotch ale character, touch of bourbon and vanilla. Nice and creamy with a good balance of scotch ale and bourbon. Id like a bit more bourbon, but overall a solid beer.

The aroma of caramel and oak barrels. The taste is of whiskey, sweetness, oak barrels with some syrup. Wonderful bitterness that fills the mouth a weak moment. I enjoy this beer really. But thats because I love whiskey too. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle: Semi-clear, burnt copper body with tons of tiny sediment bits that hang in suspension. Foamy & somewhat soapy off-white head recedes quick. Aroma of heavy raw whiskey, caramel, wood, apple, & charred oak. Heavy whiskey on the nose... I mean, really heavy. Flavor is a little more tame. Caramel apple, prune, whiskey soaked wood, very light vanilla, toasted nuts, & a grainy finish. Lots of leftover spicy oak in the aftertaste with a lingering whiskey bite. Seems like barrel overpowers everything here. Not awful but kind of messy.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Bottle 0,65l, dark amber, quite clowdy with a lot of yeast particle, almost no head. Aroma of pears and whisky. Very strong taste of whisky with noticable vanilla notes. Not bad but not the best price quality ratio.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 Bottle. Pours tea with copper notes. Large yeast particles are a bit disturbing. Aroma is paerl, apple and blended Scotch whisky. Taste is dominated by Scotch whisky, too much in my opinion. A bit of paerl. Quite sweet, not smooth. Low bitterness. Tastes rather like Scotch added to the beer and not like barrel-aged beer. I rather expect barrels to *add* not to *dominate* the taste. A dissapointment.
Caramelly, vanilla and bananas in the taste. Very balanced and creamy but thin viscosity. Beneficial barrel storage.

Orange-amber color with small head. Aroma is very much vanilla and oak, tanines, also tropical fruit syrup, banana syrup, caramel, spicy, very complex. Taste is chocolate, caramel, more fruit syrup, boozy and warming. Smooth carbonation like it should be for a barrel aged beer. Very lovely. A real winner.

The whisky barrel aged version of Hoppin Frogs Scotch. Thin, pale beige, creamy head over a hazy copper coloured beer, lighter than I am used to from this style. Seductively sweet, candyish and perfumey aroma of cranberry sauce, lychee, candied orange, dates, vanilla sugar, bourbon, passion fruit liqueur, banana ice cream, coconut, red apple, biscuit, apricots, pineapple discs in syrup, mint and chocolate. Sweet and refinedly sugary candied fruits in the taste, orange peel, smooth and resinous mouthfeel, caramelly and lightly chocolatey malt backbone, vanilla-like tannins in the finish with a refined and delightful woodiness along with a toasted touch, citrussy hops but not turning truly bitter (as expected from the style) and gently warming alcohol. Liquid candy but in an astonishingly refined and delicate way. Lovely!
reddish amber colour, some off-white head; aroma and taste of whisky, intensive malty sweetness; spicy alcohol, vanilla; woody-earthy notes and maybe some ash - great beer

350 ml on tap @ "Schouskjelleren",Oslo.
October 09, 2014.
Beer from a tulip glass.
Amber in color with a creamy beige head and medium to low carbonation.
Aroma is malt,vanilla,wood,sweetness,dark berries and some hop.
Tastes sweet and malty with a slightly boozy and warm feeling.
The beer ends with a slightly bitter finish.
Bottle sample, poured a dark red amber colour, toffee, caramel, honey, barrel, whisky, vanilla, very sweet. Low carbonation.

"Vanilla and bourbon compete a little with the toffee and peat, but they end up playing nice together. The base beer, which I really liked, is still evident, though the barrel makes it a different animal. Nicely done."

Amber red color that is rich and beautiful. Sweet heavenly whiskey notes though actually not too complex. Very malty heavy mouth with a fair amount of whiskey, but again, not a ton of depth. The whiskey adds the depth, which gives me the impression the underlying beer isnt too spectacular and the barrel aging actually adds a fair amount. Nice warming lingering boozy whisky finish. Nice, but without being outstanding.
Nice oliy red and dark berries on the nose, some whiskey. Smooth mouthfeel, a little light for the ABV, but delicious. Big caramel body, big whiskey and some dry berries. Soft, warm finish.
Draught.Muddy brown colour with small head.Aroma of roasted caramel and malt with some hint of marmalade bread and vanilla,good full body and nice strong mouth feels and oily finish.
Draught. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Draught at Taphouse. High creamy and lasting white head. Hazy red brown body. Very sweet and flowery candylke aroma. Very sweet fruity roasted malt caramel cocoa cream vanilla flavor. Low carbonation, long sweet finish. Alcoholl well hidden. Nicely balanced.

Tap. Hazy, amber body with a small, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, bread and wood. Sweet flavor that ends up dry with a hint of bitterness and some alcohol. Medium bodied, oily textute and soft carbonation. A very nice ale.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Hazy reddish amber with a off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark fruit and wood. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 270814
Starts with a strong alcohol taste followed by a sweet vanilla with a hint of whiskey. Once in a while i get a sulfury aftertaste..wtf. got it for $13.5 for a pint

Draught @ Taphouse. Pours cloudy brown with a small beige head. Aroma is toasted malt, toffee, brown sugar, prune and vanilla. Taste is near heavy sweet and light bitter. Body is medium+ , soft carbonation. Finishes sweet and malty with caramel and bourbon.

Tap. Pours hazy amber with beige head that disappears. Aroma is caramel, dried fruits, marmalade, vanilla and light toast. Certainly bourbon. Taste is heavy sweet and bourbon! Caramel, malt, vanilla. Coating mouth-feel and dry oak finish.

duft: malt. karamel. sød. frisk duft. ege.
smag: karamel. masipan sødme. en smule eg. lidt burbon smag. vanilje.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours dark amber with a small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, toffee, wood, vanilla, light bourbon. Flavor is malty, rather sweet, some caramel, wood, dark fruit, vanilla, alcohol. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, warming alcohol in th finish. 220814

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Hazy dark amber/brown with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted, wood, dark fruit and vanilla. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, medium sweet, dark fruits, wood, vanilla, little bourbon, hop,
Cloudy brown smooth offwhite head.caramel and sweet malts and toffee in the aroma. Also some sort of sweet woody note. Flavor is wood toffee booze flowers interesting flavor indeed.
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 Tap, Taphouse. Hazy, dark amber. Small, offwhite head. Aroma has malt, peat and whisky notes. Flavour is similar, very smooth, alcohol perfectly hidden. Nice. Very.
Pours a hazy copper color with no head. Aroma of wood, vanilla, sugar. Taste of bourbon was nice, but this was way too sweet for me.

Location: 22 oz bottle from Sparrow, 7/11/14


Aroma: The nose is sweet and a little boozy, toffee, oak, and vanilla

Appearance: It pours a murky reddish-orange color with a small head and light lace spots

Flavor: The taste is along the same lines, quite sweet, toffee, vanilla, and booze

Palate: The body is medium-plus and a little sticky, with a soft carbonation

Overall Impression: 
Solid beer, quite malty, but that is to be expected. I basically got what I was expecting here, nothing special, but good enough for government work.

Hoppin Frog has the worst bottle design ever. I mention this just because I think Ive mentioned it in everyone of my reviews for them and I just wanna keep the streak going. This is a cloudy orange beer w/ a short-lived and small head. It has an interesting nose w/ lots of raisin malt and a bit of banana which is really odd for the style but not bad. It is sweet and malty w/ a big-time barrel character w/ cherry and coconut being prominent. This is ever so slightly tart and a bit sticky and heavy but not too bad compared to a lot of big, barrel aged beers. I am not sure I would seek this out but it is at the very least not total garbage.

Bomber from a PUBR Docolyte. Pours chill hazy mahigany with 1-finger fizzy white head that says, "Im as rare as integrity from a Rethug, you punk!" Nose is Munich and vienna malts, earthy toffee, brown sugar, and mild hops. Tastes vienna malty, with notes of brown sugar, toffee, spirits, vanilla, oak, and finishes powerful and complex with woody vanilla, oaky, and malty notes. Finishes a bit flat, but complex.

Bottle from FlandersNed-thanks, Steve! Copper colored. Nose is some sweet malts, light vanilla. Flavor follows, but just a completely hollow beer. What do you call something that is less than one dimensional? Very disappointing.
Azt hiszem ez az első skót Ale sör, amit ittam. Különleges íze van, nagyon kellemes aromajelleggel. Kicsit meglepett "ő drágasága" (4.800,- / palack).

Bomber. Pours a cloudy reddish color with a small white head. A big boozy whiskey nose. The flavor is similar: heat, vanilla, oak, booze, a bit of berries, some toffee. More fresh hot whiskey. Rye? Ultimemtly this is pretty good but its a bit much as well. The base struggles.

22oz bottle. Poured a deeper amber color with a smaller sized off white head. Aromas of caramel, woody, toffee, vanilla, and some earthiness. Tastes of vanilla, toffee, caramel, peat/earth, malty, and some fruitiness. Lighter bourbon.
On tap. Orange color with thin white head. Bourbon aroma. Tastes of Bourbon with a slightly bitter end. Excellent.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbyond. Pours hazy, headless copper. Rich sweet, honey-floral aroma, a little alcoholic. Sweetish taste, candy-toffee-like. Smooth, full-bodied, long and sweet alcoholic finish.

Bottle thanks to Alemax. Pours copper brown with rapidly settling white head and no lacing. Aroma is oak and whisky, big caramelized sugar, toffee, fruity, plum. Flavor is caramel, nutty, toffee, with an oaky, vanilla, whisky, caramel finish. Soft carbonation, medium light body, seems a little thin for the flavor and alcohol.

22 oz. bottle, and I cant remember where I bought it. Pours an initially clear reddish amber that gets hazier as it gets lower. Yeast sediment. Small off-white head. The aroma is pretty warm, with warming whiskey throughout, and vanilla, oak, toffee, brown sugar, dates, and toast. Id guess it was higher than 8.2% ABV just based on the smell. The flavor is more muted, with notes of whiskey, toffee, oak, toast, earth, and a bit of peat. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and a mouthfeel that seems a bit thinned by the barrel but warmed from it, as well. Finishes dry. Not a perfect barrel treatment, but enjoyable.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbyond. Pours orange to brown hazy with a medium head, aroma of vanilla, malt, caramel, toffee, brandy, flavor of vanilla, brandy, malt, some wood and alcohol, medium to full bodied.

Bottle 650 ml at home, into a snifter. ABV 8.2%
Pours a darl red beer, just a tiny bit hazy, with the thinnest of lines on top playing the role of head, light beige, low retention and light lacing left on the glass.
Plenty of whiskey and wood on the aroma, sweet with caramel, brown sugar. 
Taste has also lots of bourbon but not overpowering, there are dark fruits in there too, caramel, vanilla, very well hidden alcohol, sugar.
Medium body, I expected it a bit thicker, good carbonation. Sticky palate.
Very tasty beer, its 8.2% and I had to do my best not to finish it quickly. Great.

Bomber from Tosa Wines, cellared about a month; shared with ck1 and my brother. Pours a reddish brown with a white head. Aroma has vanilla, and vanilla, with fruit. Later down in the glass, some caramelly malts. Taste is of sweet vanilla, caramel and brown sugar. Perhaps some light fruits. Medium bodied. Finishes sweet vanilla with alcohol. Suffers in following Backwoods Btard.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbyond. Clear amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, dried fruits, whiskey, vanilla, wood and some alcohol. Sweet flavor, malty, caramelly, with vanilla, wood, fruits, whiskey and some alcohol. Medium-bodied, a bit sticky and a bit boozy.

Poured from bottle, hazy orange-brown with little to no head. Smell is sugary sweet, caramel, and some whiskey. Taste is caramel malts, wood, whiskey, with a nice little burn from the alcohol. Body is medium and creamy. Overall good, but it doesnt stand out as a great barrel aged scotch ale.
Pour caramel brown with thin white head. Smoked ashy nose kind of flat. A bit of barrel in the nose and vanilla in the middle. End is sour. It has the parts...blend seems off

Pours sunset orange with a small ring of fizz. Smells strongly of the barrels and sticky sweet malt. Taste is sweet, caramel, vanilla, toffee, and barrel. Medium-bodied with a slick texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Hoppin Frog Barrel Aged Outta Kilter finishes with a sticky sweetness.
Kind of somewhere in between a barley wine and scotch ale. Oaky, malty, lots of flavour. Like a jacked-up Innis and Gunn. Nice.

Pours an even amber golden color. Scotch flavor through the while drink. Solid brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark ruby with a thin off white head. Aroma is scotch, caramel and apple. Taste mostly follows suit but adds some vanilla and woody notes. Solid alcoholic heat given the ABV. Thick syrupy palate without much carb. Very tasty.

I would call this beer a Scottish Light Ale, and I think this is a pretty good example of the style. Malty and creamy, with just a bit of an alcohol backbone. A bit watery in the mouth, but it finishes nutty and carmelly. The nose is right on, as is the color. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Oak Tree. Pours brown with off white head. Nose and taste of oak, vanilla, bourbon, resin, caramel and dark fruit. Medium body. A bit too bourbon forward, but it works for what it is.

Bottle: &nbsp Deep amber, small sudsy sandy head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Sweet biscuit and caramel on the nose. &nbsp A small touch of wood and buttery apple pie. &nbsp Sweet caramel and woody notes up front, some vanilla and candied apple or pear. &nbsp Very interesting. &nbsp Much caramel in this one. &nbsp A touch warming, but not alcoholic. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate. &nbsp Caramel finish, light fruity notes, sweet breadiness, with faint wood and vanilla. &nbsp Pretty simple, but also pretty tasty. &nbsp Thanks Kevin!

Reddish copper pour with a thin off white bubbly head ... aroma of oak, vanilla, whiskey, caramel malts and light roasted malts .... taste is of wood, light whiskey, sweet caramel malts, light vanilla and light warming booze, with some light roasted malts .... mouthfeel is thinner than Id thought .... if only the taste matched the aroma on this brew it would be 3.8 all day long
Bottle thanks to jstax...Pour is golden with a thin white head that fades..Nose is nice spice, caramel, whisley, candy, chewy toffee..Taste is caramel, spice, chewy, whiskey, barrel, sweetness..

pours brown, cream head that slithers to a ring. bourbon, booze, cherries in nose. base layer of bourbon from beginning to end, flashed of pitted fruit, caramel. body is big but creamy. bourbon lingers.
Great brew. Pours reddish yellow with a fluffy tan head and sediment. Aroma is fruity and vanilla. Very smooth and sweet...sticky finish.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, dark reddish brown pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of dark chocolate, vanilla, oak, coconut, hints of caramel, toffee, slight earth, touch of grass. Taste is a mix of caramel, toffee, hints of oak, slight vanilla, hints of earth, grass, slight molasses, finishing sweet, lots of barrel.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of arminjewell. Thanks! Pours a touch hazy dark reddish orange appearance with a thin tan head. Tannic, vanilla, very woody, slightly fruity, caramel, pretty rich aroma. Carbonation seems a bit low. Flavor is really dominated by oak and vanilla along with some toffee, orange citrus, and caramel. A touch boozy on the finish. Not too bad but also not something I would purchase on my own.

Bottle from Wineworks. Aroma is sweet oranges, caramel, butterscotch, citrus, and sugar. Pours red with a small lingering white head. Taste is muddled amber ale homebrew; pine needles, citrus peel, malt, brown sugar, and a sweet bourbon finish. Mouthfeel was annoyingly sweet and sticky for what little complexity it brought. I was not a fan of this one.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2014 Bottle. Beige pour with tan head. Sweet bourbon and oak aromas. Flavors are sweet malt and some bourbon and oak tones, bourbon scotch ale not overly anything else. Finish is nice.(edit for sp)

A: Reddish/Brown Hue, Passes Some Light, Thin White Head Ring, Mild Lacing

S: Sweet Bourbon, Honey, Mild Raisins

T: Bourbon, Raisins

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet

Overall, the bourbon is sweet and the scotch ale gets buried in the background.

22oz bomber from Spirits Brick. Poured a muddy reddish/brown with a smaller foamy light beige head. Aroma is nice and complex. Notes of whiskey, caramel, raisins and prunes, wood, alcohol, fruit cake, cake batter. Fuller lightly syrupy body with softer but definietly there carbonation. Flavor of alcohol and whiskey, brown toast, wet wood, barrel, dry caramel some raisin. Solid beer but this seems to get better with warmth.

Bottle shared with Edgar. Snifter. Pours an amber brown with nearly no light passing. One finger white head. Aroma strong with wood barrel, booze, caramel, vanilla and ripe fruits. The taste is amazingly smooth with wood barrel, vanilla, caramel, booze (not too heavy) and leather. Full body, well balanced. Smooth finish with wood and caramel. Very very nice beer.

0,65 l bottle, Csakajósör, Budapest.
Poured opalescent deep amber with a creamy tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee and vanilla, bourbon. The flavor starts with caramel, toffee, and a touch of fruit. The finish has light vanilla, bourbon, and just a hint of smoke. Its medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat sticky mouthfeel. Fine and balanced, yumm!

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2014 Hazy medium amber with a thin, disappearing, white, thin head. Smells of deep caramel, soya sauce, toasted malt with alcohol and cherries. Medium to full oily body. Tastes of caramel, with toasted malt, and a cherry malty finish. Smooth and very malty with soft yeast and a caramel finish. Decent.
Bottle at THT tasting. Aroma is caramel, bourbon, alcohol, Rev fruits and Toffee. taste is quite sweet and smooth. Full bodied and soft carbonation. Awesome
Poured reddish amber with a frothy beige head. Aroma of vanilla smoothness and dark fruit, alcohol soaked raisin. Full body, flavour very much as the aroma, sweet lingering finish.

22 ounce bottle. Served in a thistle glass, the beer pours a hazy reddish brown color with about a half inch off-white head. Head retention and lacing are both decent enough. Aroma is nice and malty, the brew smells like toasted malt, caramel, vanilla, whiskey, and raisins. I think the taste is similar to the aroma, but theres the addition of some apple and toffee flavors. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit syrupy and slick with low/moderate carbonation. I like this better than the regular Outta Kilter, its worth a try if you come across it. $12.99 a bottle.

Bottle 22fl.oz.Clear medium amber orange colour with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, sweet malt, fruity, wood. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, caramel, wood, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130427]

from Erzbierschof - pours a cloudy brown beer with a modest head retention; aroma of prune, caramel and candy sugar; some Speyside whisky-like notes; full-bodied and very sweet, subtle carbonation, gently bitter and with lot of residual sweetness, more notes of prunes and toffee and a stronger wood presence as well in the finish
Gedronken @ RBESG 13 Grand Tasting, bruin/oranje kleur, helder, witte schuimkraag, ruikt en smaakt naar vanille, kruidig, andere drank, sterke alcohol, maar wel lekker, niet vervelend.

Bottle: The aroma consists of caramel, toffee, faint chocolate, faint vanilla, and bourbon. It pours a mostly transparent amber with a good amount of floaters. It has a one finger khaki head that quickly fades to a thin film. The flavor starts with caramel, toffee, and a touch of fruit. The finish has light vanilla, bourbon, and just a hint of smoke. Its medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat sticky mouthfeel.
Bottle @ RBESG. Aroma is huge bourbon and vanilla, some wood, caramel and bready notes. Flavour is vanilla, caramel, oak, bread, and light molasses and liquorice. Awesome.

Clear red colour, white head. Aroma of candy sugar, caramel, bourbon and toffee. Sweet flavour, bourbon, vanilla. Decent amount of carbo, finish wood, malts, caramel, bourbon, lingering sweetness.
(From 66cL bottle @ RBESG 2013 Grand Tasting, Bodegraven. Thanks for sharing, dEnk!)
I dont love Scot ales but if I did I would have rated this higher, bottle from Cleveland Beer Fest, decent scotch red ale.

Poured on tap at the source. Pours a hazy copper with a beige head that dissipates quickly. Aroma has big woody notes and vanilla creeping in to cover a bit of the boozy bite. Tastes Bourbon and wet wood up front that gives way quickly to a soft malty backbone and vanilla finish. Definitely preferred to the non barreled version.
Bottle. Deep amber beer with an offwhite head. Dried dark fruits, malty and caramell aroma. Toffee, sweet, malty and dark dried fruits flavour. Lovely beer :-)

Sampled @ RBESG 13 Grand Tasting. Clear amber colour with a minimal sized white head. Smells caramel, malts, wood, alcohol and toffee. Tastes vanilla, caramel, lovely deep and sweet. Full body, soft carbo, silky feel.

(bottle) pours a clear deep amber colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy green apples, light pale malts, honey, marzipan, powdered sugar and some higher alcohols. flavour is mostly the same, though quite mellow, with notes of caramel, honey, marshmallow and a light sweetness. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle @ RBESG13 Grand Tasting @ De Molen: Served in a Molen taster: Thanks for sharing dEnk:
Medium to smaller sized head (didnt wrote the color down, must have been talking too much with Chriso and Boudicca). A clear orange amber colored beer.
Aroma was just bourbon! A slight tint hint of malts and cream but overtaken by the dominating bourbon.
Flavours were also pushed to the back because of the overwhelming bourbon. Some bitterness, spicy and creamy tones, hints of malts, porridge and honey but overall... Bourbon!
Aftertaste.. You guessed it: bourbon with some hints of malts, and again spices and cream.
Low carbo, soft creamy silky mouthfeel, medium to fuller body and a creamy sticky texture.
Though the bourbon takes control its still easy drinkable, balanced and smooth.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: #300 USA beer. 65 cl. bottle sampled @ RBESG 2013. Thx! to dEnk. Bright amber, head is only bubbles. Nose is sweet caramel, good kind of oxidation, mod. Caramel, sugar, very sweet good, lots of great sweetness, toffee. Taste is very rich caramel, toffee, thick barrel, toffee, hint bitter herbs, vanilla, oily, Taste is light oxidation, very smooth & rich. Wonderful, way better than the non-BA version.
Pours an amber beer with a good white head. Smells pretty sweet and a bit like wine. it tastes like coffee and caramel.

66cl Bottle at RBESG 13 Grand Tasting. Amber colour, off-white head. Aroma of sweet malts, brown sugar, a little metal, prunes and raisins, hint of vanilla. Flavour is sweet, malty, amber malts, metal, raisins, hint of vanilla from the oak barrel. Medium-bodied. Its OK, but I just dont really like these kind of beers.

Bottle at RBESG 13 Grand Tasting. Pours clear amber with a small off-white head and some particles floating in it. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, caramel and some raisins. Taste is quite sweet with bourbon, caramel, raisins and some oxidation.

Bottle at the RBESG 2013 Grand Tasting. Poured a chestnut brown with a broken white head. The aroma is malt and caramel. The flavour is medium bitter and toffee! Its lovely rich, oily and oh so smooth. A really superb beer from Hoppin Frog. I really need to buy this brewery!

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Rerate: bottle from Burg Bieren, large sample. Clear copper color, short frothy off-white head. Aroma of biscuit, vanilla, cookie, citrussy fruit, hint of raisin, caramel, hint of juniper. Quite sweet in taste, vanilla, cookie, fruity notes. All blending together quite nicely. Slight alcoholic finish. Bit thin perhaps. Fruity and raisiny finish. 3.9
Bottled @ RBESG 2013 Grand Tasting. Caramel, toffee, not much vanilla in the aroma. Much more vanilla sweetness in flavor. Taste is far better than the aroma. 3.6

Sample at rbesg 2013.
Thin white head. Clear amber golden pour. Lots of vanilla. Lovely.

Bottle @ RBESG grand tasting. Clear orange to reddish color, small white head. Smell and taste malts, sweetness, hints of barrel aging but not that much, a touch of vanilla, lightly alcohol and caramel. Medium to full body, medium carbonation.
Koperkleurig. Iets troebel. Aardige schuimkraag. Ruikt fris zoetig. Smaakt candy zoet. Iets te zoey.

RBESG 2013. Bottle during Grand Tasting at De Molen. Amber/copper beer with yeast, small beige head. Malty roasted aroma, woody, biscuits, toffee, vanilla notes, caramel, biscuit notes. Malty vinous aroma, woody, vanilla, sourish, floral, vanilla and wood notes. Pleasant beer.

Nice development from non-barrel aged version. Brownish red ruby amber. Fair wispy off-white head, lasting. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark fruit, vanilla, some spices and booze. Flavor follows. Medium body, smooth and soft. Malty sweet, light touch of the barrel. This really benefited from the barrel aging.

strong scotch and caramel aroma.  brown sugar, maybe a little vanilla.
first sop-scotch, but a liitle muted with caramel. very smooth and surprisingly light.  a bit of an alcohol burning aftertaste.  
Barrel Aged remarkably better than regular kilter

22 ounce bottle into snifter; bottled in 8/2012.  Pours hazy deep ruby red color with a small cream colored head with decent retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers.  Light spotty lacing clings on the glass.  Aromas of big raisin, cherry, apple, fig, caramel, toast, brown sugar, oak, toffee, clove, bourbon, vanilla, and toasted earthiness.  Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of malt, fruitiness, and barrel notes; with good strength.  Taste of raisin, fig, apple, caramel, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, toffee, oak, clove, bourbon, vanilla, and toasted earthiness.  Lingering notes of light fruits, caramel, toast, brown sugar, toffee, brown bread, oak, clove, bourbon, vanilla, and toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice complexity of malt and fruity flavors; with a very well balanced barrel presence and zero cloying flavors after the finish.  Light-medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a slight and lightly syrupy mouthfeel that is good.  Alcohol is well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a damn nice barrel aged scotch ale!  All around nice balance and complexity of flavors; and very smooth to sip on.  A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle @ yespr. Pours a pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy woody caramel aroma. Sweetish malty spicy woody whiskey caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty woody spicy vanilla and bourbon finish with hints of caramel.

Bottle (22 oz). Thanks to the guy who brought this to the Hill Farmstead 3rd anniversary bottle share. Murky copper with a small than head and little to no lacing. Aroma is of caramel, toffee, bourbon, vanilla, wood and light fruity notes. Taste is moderately sweet and malty with caramel, toffee, bourbon, vanilla, bread, wood and red fruits. Medium to full body. Soft to medium carbonation. My small pour wasnt cloying at all (especially with the so cold weather we had for the outdoor bottle share), but I can understand why some people wrote this in their rating. Quite complex. Nice barrel treatment. Very good Scotch Ale.
Une scotch ale legerement plus houblonnée que la normale, des malts moyennement sucrés, la barrique discrète, correct.

Pours a mostly clear amber with a medium white head.  Aroma has caramle and toffee...lightly toasted malts.  Flavor has some boozy notes...very malty and earthy/hoppy.  Mouthfeel is medium/full and the finish is bitter/earthy aand muddled malts.  Meh...

22 oz bottle, Andersons, $11.99 or $12.99.  Had the non-barrel-aged 22 oz last night.  Same unfiltered murky dark copper pour; dissipates into a small ring and a very light, sparse covering.  -Much- more notable oak and vanilla and wood than the non-BA version, and surprisingly boozier too.  Probably more dark fruit (prune?) than the non-BA.  This was a fun beer to taste test because against the non-BA.  With the non-BA at about 8 bucks Id like to see the BA version at a little less of a markup, but this is really, really good.

Bottle acquired via trade with Homer321!  Hazy burnt tangerine pour with some scarlet, garnet, and ruby red hues.  A solid eggshell cap and a significant number of chunks floating around.  Moderate barrel shown in the nose with some oak, vanilla, bourbon, and caramel prominent.  Flavor is balanced between the barrel and base beer also.  Vanilla, wood, toffee, caramel, molasses, and even some maple.  Medium mouthfeel.  Surprised how integrated the barrel is despite its lower ABV.

Bottle at Yesprs - Thanks. Clear dark amber/brown - offwhite head. Caramel, sweetness, coconut, fruity, whiskey, candy sweetnes, dried fruits, red berries, light tobacco, high high sweetness, wooden, tanning, light vanilla.

Bottled. Dark amber coloured. Unclear. Dense light brown head. ARoma: Ripe fruits, caramel, sweetness, brown sugar, spice. Flavour. Ripe fruits, sweetness, vanilla, oak, caramel. Medium to full bodied. Ends sweet and spiced.

Bottle at yespr. 
Clear orange coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel, dried fruits, oak and vanilla.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, dried fruits and licorice with notes of oak and vanilla.
Sweet finish.

Bottled. A hazy red beer with a thin off-white head. The aroma has notes of caramel, alcohol, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, malt, bread, and caramel, leading to a dry finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
22 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy brown with a small off white head. Aroma is toasted malty. Toffee malty and phenolic. Toasted and bitter. Phenolic and toasted malty finish.

Bottle 65 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a clear amber with a small, beige head. Sweet Bourbon aroma, thick licorice all-sorts. Sweet, malty body, thick caramel, vanilla, wood and Bourbon with hardly any hops. Very rich and filling - some may find it cloying. 270413

22oz bottle 4/17/13 (Binnys Downers Grove)R.I.P. Frisco-40° in Thistle like glass-Pours a murky dark amber with a small tan ring for a head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, toffee, and vanilla, and bourbon. Taste of the same with more bourbon, oak, and vanilla. This full bodied brew is well balanced and quite tasty. Fills a prefect night of grieving.
Bottle @ home ... It pours dark amber with a small light tan head....The aroma is peat whiskey, oak, vanilla and caramel.....The flavor is dark fruit, wood, bourbon and caramel.....

Pours a cloudy brown with not much head. White and what there is falls to thin ring quickly.
Sweet malty biscuit aroma.
The flavor is out of balance, being mostly the barrel.
Bottle, dark amber pour, aroma and flavour was mostly the barrels, I got a bit of carmel like flavours, overall drinkable
Pours an orangeish color with a light tan head.  Aroma has tons of whiskey peat.  Tate is sweet and a little hot.  Thin bodied.  Not bad.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Pours ruby red with a thin wisp of white head that swirls in the glass. Aroma is plum and booze soaked cherries with oak, vanilla bean and sharp whiskey notes. Taste is dark fruit, wood, bourbon, and fig. Light to medium body with thin, slick texture. Really short on the finish, I feel as if the back end of this is absent. Otherwise a tasty beer overall.

Pours a murky copper brown from the bottle with fluffy tab head that dissipates to leave good lacing. Aroma is scotch, caramel malt, and oak. Taste follows with added hints of vanilla and piney bitterness. Sweet but very nice and booze well hidden, good stuff.

22oz bottle courtesy of goryshkewych.  Cheers, George!  Pours a hazy caramel brown with an off-white head.  Nose is sweet malt, some wood, vanilla, maple, and booze. Flavor follows with sweet malt up front and oaky boozy sweetness behind.  Medium in body for the style and nice overall.
bomber shared by ontbeermaker and scottatron. deep amber with a tan head. aroma of sweet barley candy, red apple and sugar. the flavour is the same. i didnt get much barrel character, pretty gross.

Bomber to snifter.   Lots of floaters in a hazy deep red pour.  Minimal head.  Thin and a bit syrupy.  Sweet vanilla flavors.  A bit of spice.  Nice carbonation.  Smooth and delicious.  A little booze in the nose.

Pours a reddish black with little head. Huge whiskey barrel, vanilla, toffee and earthy notes in the aroma. Medium body, toffee and hints of whiskey barrel in the taste. Good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Belmont bottle that somehow we ended up with about 3 of these? Anyway...copper/amber colored pour with a small head of big bubbles. Aroma of sweet malt, barrel wood and I swear a hint of grape juice. Creamy mouthfeel. There are some nice barrel notes in the flavor with more sweet malt and a hint of booze. Nice

Tap. Poured clear brown color with an average frothy off-white head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt, nuts and vanilla wood aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted sweet whiskey flavor with medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate duration. This is good complex beer.
Sour and sweet, thanks Johnsense. Honeyish. Dark brown coloured body. Barreling was good. Decent drinkability.

Poured from 22oz bottle into my snifter glass, pours with no head, thick mouthfeel, aroma is full on barrel, oak, vanilla, some sweetness.   A little bready on the back end.   
Taste follows the nose, heavy on the barrel with a little sweetness. 
Finishes with more booze.   

Ok offering from an exceptional brewery.   

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours redish murky brown. Aroma of sweet bread and a little whisky.  taste is thin sweet berries bread and a little barrel

Smelled like a drunk prostitute. Aromas were full of Honey Jack Daniels and perfumey fruitiness. This one poured out syrupy and thick with no head at all. Flavors are similar with tons of whiskey and a light red fruit and caramel hint. Not bad but too unbalanced to be great.

22oz bomber ---> The pour was a cloudy rusty orange with LITTLE signs of carbonation. It smelled like whiskey with some soft wood notes, but hints of cherries and bread were very nice. The taste was full of whiskey too with a buttery malty background. This beer was thin, sweet, not too complex but just fun to drink. Thanks Jordan.

Bottle... Hazy amber ale with orange highlights and a small, creamy, off-white head. The bouquet is a mélange of spiced rum, vanilla, cola and oak. Medium-bodied with feather-soft carbonation. The flavor offers moderately sweet caramel and a light note of vanilla. Finishes minerally and flat. Bottle courtesy of darkguardian!

Dark amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of smoky sweet malt, vanilla, licorice, & some bourbon; Flavor of sweet malt, light oak, caramel/toffee, molasses/syrup, dark fruit, and spice; Warm finish; Nicely balanced, Overall, more depth with the barrel aging - pretty good.

Bomber.  Poured medium coppery-amber with a short, nice-looking yellowy-beige head.  The aroma picked up sweet caramel, vanilla, whiskey, and raisins, with wisps of airy smoked peat and herbal hops accenting.. a hint of medicinal alcohol on the back of the nose.. quite strong overall.  The flavor found tangy whiskey and oak barrel throughout.. sweet vanilla and caramel on the middle.. really dried out toward the back and through the finish.. solid, but it didnt flow great.  Medium-bodied with low-ish carbonation on the palate.. a little too strong with the barrel, but solid overall.

22 oz. bottle via trade with fatknitty - Pours a hazy light brown color with a half finger thick light tan head.  faint spotty lacing.  Aroma is oak and caramel malt.  Flavor is oak, toasted caramel malt, and light vanilla. The finish is slightly boozy.  Medium body.  Im not a fan of Scotch ales, but the barrel aging helps.  A good beer.  Thanks Joe.

Pours a cloudy deep red color with nearly no head.  Very little lacing.  Aroma is dominated by whiskey and vanilla with a hint of caramel.  Taste is exactly like the aroma and its bit too much whiskey flavor for me.  It is well made though.  Lots of vanilla helps to calm the whiskey a bit but the base beer doesnt come through enough.  Very little caramel taste.  Finish leaves a long lingering vanilla taste with some booze and toasted wood.  Medium body, slightly sticky mouthfeel.  Decent beer but I would like more balance here between the base beer and the barrel taste.

off brownish red pour w/ a small whispy white head.  NIce aroma rich sweet malty some whiskey and oak and vanilla notes hints of a red ale touches of scotch in the finish.  Rich well coated and lightly creamy palate.  Syruppy sweet taste loads of brown sugar then oak notes, whiskey, touch of vanilla.  Quite good.

22 oz. bottle, sent from jmikolich (thanks a lot, Jim), pours a cloudy dark orange amber with a small white head. Aroma of whiskey barrels, scotch, caramel malts and brown sugar. Flavour is very similar, with whiskey barrels, caramel malts, and booze. Having not tried the base beer, I have no comparison for which to base this to, but this is quite complex and boozy. Solid scotch ale.

This poured a darker red color with a small beige head.  Aroma was light dark fruits, good amount of barrel, and loight roasted caramel.  Flavor was much the same, mainly all barrel as the original beer doesnt have much flavor to begin with.  Not the greatest but exceptable.

22oz bottle .. . pours a deep maroon .. . medium foam, light lacing .. . lots of whiskey, light molasses and aggie blood .. . mouth is also a bit thin .. . mostly a really good beer but seems a bit out there 

.. . . dancing and drinking, thats what the problem..

Thanks to Darkguardian for sharing this rarity.  Murky copper brown pour with an off white head.  Sweet rum and coke aromas.  Achie machie, all kinds of rum and coke with a heavy bourbon finish.  The best way I can describe is like this: imagine a drunk guy pouring rum into a glass, adding the ice, adding the cola and then forgetting what he was doing and topping the drink with bourbon.  Yea, thats it exactly...

10/29/12. 22oz bottle from Grassroots. Hazy dark amber/brown pour with a small tan head that fades to a small ring fast. Very nice aroma that shows whiskey barrel, oak, vanilla, coconut candy, butterscotch, and plenty of that nice base - caramel, malt, dark fruits, a hint of chocolate, and more. Theres also a touch of alcohol in there. The flavor is also good, though perhaps doesnt deliver on the aroma as well as it could. Theres a rich malty aspect with caramel and butterscotch followed by the barrel characteristics, including vanilla, coconut, wood, etc. Theres a lingering roasty, chocolate, almost ashy aspect as well. Tasty!
Sweet malty aromas. Malty sweet flavors with a little oak. Overall a very good barrel aged wee heavy.

Pours amber with a golden hue and off white head. The aroma is sweet almost honey like malts. The flavor brings no sweetness though, but a bit of spicy malt flavors from the barrels and lighter booze notes that dont overpower as I was expecting.

Bottle. Courtesy of GandGKevin! Ruby amber with a medium, foamy tan head. Strong vanilla, toasted coconut, oak and booze in the nose along with caramel and sweet malt. Taste continues the strong vanilla, toasted coconut and oak notes and they are dominant. Caramel, brown sugar, sweet malt and faint cake make up the rest of the flavor profile. Body is medium with a soft, bubbly carbonation and a moderate warmth. Ends with more toasted coconut, vanilla and oak along with soft caramel and malt notes.

Poured into a perfect pint.

3.0 A: Lightly hazed dark orange amber color. Not quite one finger of fizzy tan head. Retention is poor and no lacing is left.

3.0 S: Whiskey and its booziness from start to finish. Earth and mineral, leather, pie crust, slight tobacco, and plum fruitiness. Caramel and graininess from the base beer, but as far as Im concerned, the beer cant keep up with the barrel. Its not bad, but I prefer the barrel to be complementary and not the main focus.

3.0 T: Like the nose, this is all about the whiskey. Flavors mentioned above fit the bill for this section as well. The nose is mild to moderately boozy, but the alcohol is well hidden in the taste. Lots of whiskey flavors with caramel, toffee, and graininess from the base. Very faint smokiness that could come from either the beer or the whiskey.

2.5 M: Light to lighter medium body. Carbonation is on the lower side, but is okay. Too light and not creamy enough. Smooth though.

2.5 D: HF usually kills it, but this isnt very impressive. This would be a good whiskey mans beer, but it sure isnt a good beer mans beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-29-2012 23:15:50

Bottle shared by DalzAle. Pours hazy/cloudy dark amber with a tight off white head. Aroma is whiskey and malt caramel and subtle spice. Taste is all of the above with a good fruity malty flavor along with whiskey and wood. Palate is medium to full with a dry chalky finish. Nice warming brew!

Bottle thanks to StFun!  Hazy mediuam brown pour, almost no carbonation and an aroma of strong sweet whiskey.  Flavor is nice mellow meld of a good malt base, nuts and leathery woody whiskey.  Really nice!
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bomber - thanks Greg! Murky orange amber pour with a smaller white head. Whiskey, vanilla, pepper, and caramel - just fantastic. Not too hot either. Really well done.

Bomber from Proof.  Amber pour with thin off-white and a ring of retention.  Aroma is sweet caramel malt and vanilla.  Same in the taste with oak, whiskey, earthy, molasses, apple.  Texture is slick medium.  Ok.  Not my favorite style.
Impresionante! No hace casi espuma, pero es muy aromática e intensa en boca. El toque de whisky está muy marcado. Muy fácil de beber.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2013 Pours hazy reddish brown with no head. Aroma of straight whiskey. Wow. Expecting a shot of jameson, but it really just accents the bold red ale flavors. Some cherry notes going on here with maybe a little oaky smoke and some Belgian flavors strangely enough (quad?). A bit chewey on the mouthfeel. Very nice overall. A sipper, but very drinkable. A real fall Friday night beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours an orangish red. The aroma is more of a lager than anything. The taste is smoother than the aroma. Nice flavor throughout the drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The whiskey barrel aging is evident before the first sip with a delightful aroma. Whiskey, vanilla, smoked peat blend extremely well. Some heat from the 8.2% ABV, but I dont think as much as the original version. Just as it should be with Scotch ales, there is little to no presence from the hops. A twinge of bitterness at the end is all that is noticeable. Incredibly smooth and really coats the mouth with a delicious layer of whiskey goodness.

The barrel aging definitely adds flavor and texture, even if it does subdue some of the complexity of the non-barrel aged version. But if you like whiskey and Scotch ales in general, get it if you can!

Courtesy of Dak! Pours copper with off white head of foam. The aroma offers up brief hits of molasses and sweet dark fruity esters before fairly thick levels of boozy whiskey and oak take over. The taste is straight up smooth sweet whiskey and oak with slivers of sweet molasses sticking to the side every now and then. The barrel age treatment has swallowed up most of the base beer essence, its a shame.

Bottle shared by a friend. Pours a clear reddish copper with a thin beige head. Malty and caramelly aroma with whiskey and cherry notes. Malty and caramelly flavor with a smooth whiskey warmth and a spicy finish.
Cloudy amber pour, cream colored head.  Aroma of booze, oak, toffee, apple, light peat and vanilla. Flavor is sweet, light smoke notes, chewy malts.

Sample at the Hopsnobbery Collective barrel-aged beer tasting on 08/11/2012. Hazy dark amber pour with a medium off-white head that diminishes to an outer ring. Stringy lace on the glass. Aroma of caramel malt and subtle booze. Medium-bodied with flavors of earthy malt, caramel and oaky vanilla. The finish is smooth and sweet with a lingering malty aftertaste. Above average overall.

22oz bottle. Hazy slightly dark ruby red color. No head. Big body. Light carbonation. More of a smoother texture. Light earthy hops. Wood. Sweet caramel malts arent as heavy as I thought theyd be. Less of a bite than I expected. Scotch flavor is sort of reserved, but makes a solid appearance through the finish. Light smokiness. Some notes of tropical fruit. Surprisingly inoffensive (Im not usually a fan of the style). Light bitter. Moderate sweet taste. Decent thin khaki head on the 2nd pour. Nice light whiskey aftertaste. Shared some with my mom, she seemed to really enjoy it. Better than expected

Bottle from the brewery: pours hazy, reddish amber, small dense off white ring, subtle lacing. Nose is peat, whiskey, rye malts, dark fermented fruit. More of the same on the palate, nice body and not overly barrel aged. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber to oversized snifter. Looks good; an opaque reddish-brown with thin white lacing. Smells solid; whiskey and malt. Tastes good; like it smells, but better with good balance and a nice mouthfeel. Good stuff, especially for the price!
